reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a visit to Napa and Sonoma, and we spent 2 nights at the Hotel Healdsburg. The hotel was very modern and comfortable. The staff was friendly and courteous. The complimentary breakfast each morning was very good. We had dinner one night at the Dry Creek Kitchen located in the hotel. The restaurant was beautiful, our server was wonderful, and the food was delicious. We had lunch one day at Charcuterie just around the corner on Healdsburg Avenue, and it was great -- highly recommend this one. Healdsburg is a charming town, and the Hotel Healdsburg was the perfect place to stay.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our visit at the Hotel Healdsburg!
We had a great stay
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The room was great. The concierge, Tiggins, did a great job. She made our dinner reservations at Cyrus (which we adored), as well as Dry Creek (the restaurant is fine, although not as good as we had expected). She gave us great bike routes. We enjoyed our massage at the spa. All in all, no complaints. A bit of noise outside the windows, but nothing that prevented us from sleeping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Healdsburg for 2 nights in October. We were attending a wedding in Healdbsurg and the wedding rehearsal dinner was at the hotel. The location is ideal on the main square. We were on the second floor at the rear of the property which was quiet except for a little noise from the bar on the Saturday night which was reasonable.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but should be for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are excellent, they are enormous with a fantastic size shower and bath. Decent toiletries but no shower gel which is surprising. Lovely decor and a fantastic bed.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay - excellent staff in luxurious setting

reviews.text: Service - Breakfast was a very good continental and laid back in front of the fire. Didn't use the pool, gym or spa so can't comment. The wedding rehearsal was fantastic with fantastic food and nice local wine.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers Revisted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from an extended weekend at the Hotel Healdsburg. Everything about this hotel is done right. The staff could not have been friendlier and they went out of their way to accomodate all of our needs. The concierge booked all of our dinners (Dry Creek Kitchen, Bistro Ralph's, Barndiva, & Willy's, all excellent)! Our spa treatments & staff were wonderful. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best "hotel breakfasts" I have experienced. The architecture, furnishings, ambience were above our expectations. The little touches like complimentary fresh ice tea, lemonade and water bottles in the lobby for guests to enjoy were well received. Whenever we went for a bike ride to the wineries, or out in the car ~ chilled water bottles were waiting for us in our cars or on our bikes. We quickly became friends of the staff and everyone from the valets, to the front staff knew our names and made us feel very much at home.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway
Loved the Hotel but construction across the street a problem!
reviews.text: The town square, great shops (Clutch & Limestone), little cafes, tasting rooms, really make Healdsburg a unique and enjoyable experience. I recommend making reservations for the wineries that offer public tours, and stopping by the outdoor cafe at Coppola Winery to enjoy brick oven pizza while overlooking the vineyards. Stokes Bike Shop is in walking distance of the hotel and even came in early one morning when we wanted to get a jump start on our day. A visit to Powell's (an old fashion candy store) is a must when in Healdsburg.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend the Hotel Healdsburg as a perfect weekend getaway.
reviews.title: Caution Re: Spa Visits!

reviews.text: My husband and I visited the Sonoma area for the first time. We loved it! Healdsburg is a great little town and wonderful square with plenty of tasting rooms and restaurants within very close walking distance from the Hotel Healdsburg. HH is very modern. The lobby is comfy and they offer a great complimentary breakfast with fruit, toast, cereals, tea, fritattas, and lox and bagels. Our room was very nice, modern. Beds were comfy. Large bathroom with a soaking tub and separate showers. We had two great massages at the spa, however, spa staff was a little unorganized or less attentive than most. For example, there were no towels for the jacuzzi area. The pool area is nice and the lounge chairs are fabulous! There was not poolside food or drink service offered the whole 2 hours we were there though. The concierge was very helpful in making travel and dinner arrangements for us. We used Jason at Vine Rover Tours to tour wineries in the area and LOVED IT! It's expensive but totally worth it to us and made it a truly once in a lifetime experience. We visited many smaller, unique wineries we would never have known to visit otherwise with wine that can't be purchased in AR. Okay, here's my only problem with the Hotel Healdsburg, at 5:30 am both mornings we woke up to what we though was a trash truck but it lasted hours!!! It sounded like it was literally in our room. There was consistent clanging and you could hear the reverse warning alarms on the truck. It was absolutely miserable!!! I thought after the first day that it was just a fluke but it happened the next day as well. I told the desk clerk at check out and she seemed clueless and just said Sorry. Our airport drive told us it's actually construction and they're building a new commerical area there. The hotel really needs to do something about the start time--5:30 am on the dot is just ridiculous! Also, the hotel forgot our wake-up call. Good thing I also set my blackberry. We loved the property and the area but could have used a few more hours of sleep! I can't say enough how loud it was! For the near future, you might want to request a room on the Dry Creek Kitchen side of the property.
reviews.title: Great Retreat
Not so much
reviews.text: Enjoyed the Hotel Healdsburg UNTIL a visit to the spa, where the attendent removed my 25th wedding anniversary, diamond and emerald necklace and failed to return it to me. When I realized that the necklace had not been given back to me or placed back around my neck I immediately phoned to speak with the mgr. There was NO MGR on premise to assist with the problem, the spa was now closed. The front desk sent a parking attendent to look for the necklace in the spa compound with no success. I was informed that the substitute manager had left the premises early at 6PM and there was no one that could help me other than the parking attendent who was also bartending? The mgmt and owners refuse to acknowledge any responsibility for the thievery and neglect in handling my personal property. They are labeling the necklace as lost, lost by whom? THEM! VERY DISAPPOINTED in their lack of hotel ethics and caution anyone staying there to watch for thievery as I have knowledge of ongoing problems.

This was a repeat visit to HH, and just as good as my previous experiences. Great bathroom (although it was starting to show a bit of wear and tear), the bed is one of the best I've ever slept in, a solid breakfast buffet and the location is perfect. My room faced the street, which was a bit noisy, but not terrible. I'd request a courtyard facing room if noise is a concern.

reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Healdsburg for 3 nights. I was there with a group and I hadn't booked the hotel, so I wasn't sure what to expect.
reviews.title: Great stay at Hotel Healdsburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are modern and comfortable with the softest bed I think I have ever slept in - I hated leaving it in the morning. The breakfast served each morning in the lobby area was delicious. A friend was upgraded to a suite and the bathroom was something to behold. Splurge on the suite if possible. One word of caution: the rooms facing the street were a little noisy due to early morning deliveries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right on the town square, which is very charming, and close to everything. For those with a sweet tooth, check out Powell's Sweet Shop across the square. They have every candy you can think of, including a nostalgia section with all the candies you ate as a child.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are numerous restaurants to choose from within a few blocks of the hotel - the Dry Creek Kitchen attached to the hotel was very good. Steer clear of Bear Republic Brewing Company for anything other than a beer. The food was minimal at best.
reviews.title: Still the best
Great place to stay
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel healdsburg from December 22-24. From the moment we arrived our every need was taken care of. The hotel staff are friendly and attentive. Being a week-end the conceirge was not available until Monday so the front desk arranged dinner reservations for us at a lovely restaurant, Zinn. There is a complimentary breakfast each morning with a variety of fresh fruits, baked goods and hot items. The rooms are lovely and modern with a feather king bed and new furnishings. My only complaint would be that the hot water never gets truly hot in the tub/shower and the flat screen t.v. is a little small for the room (although we didn't end up using it). There is wi-fi in each room as well as a free computer/printer on each floor. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others in the future.

reviews.title: Terrific!
reviews.text: This is such a wonderful hotel. Great location, lovely rooms, friendly staff. This was our 4th visit and as usual everything was perfect. The central location, proximity to shopping, wine tasting, and fine dining make this one of the best places to stay in Healdsburg.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a special dinner we highly recommend the tasting menu (with wine pairings) at Dry Creek Kitchen.
reviews.title: Very elegant

reviews.text: This is one of our favorite wine country spots so we will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Healdsburg

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our 1 night stay there. Our friend gave us a free night stay (during the week). We were upgraded to a "junior suite". Very clean and elegant, somewhat trendy. Wonderful feather topped bed and down comforter. We settled in and went to dinner at Dry Creek Kitchen (also very good). After we checked out a free DVD at the front desk and settled in the room to watch a movie. The bathroom was wonderful...huge soaking tub and glass shower. The breakfast was very good...salmon, fritata , and sausage (with fruit, etc.). All of the staff were very accomodating, and knew our names when we checked in (Troy was especially helpful).
reviews.title: Nice but quirky
